intro: Airopsis insularis, commonly known as the island sea whip, is a marine algae belonging to the family Halymeniales. It is characterized by its branching, whip-like structure and is typically found in shallow coastal waters. The plant has a gelatinous texture and is often attached to rocky substrates. It plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat for various small organisms. Airopsis insularis is primarily distributed in tropical and subtropical regions of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans.
